meanings.definition: Relating to the study of bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The bacteriologic research lab was filled with microscopes and petri dishes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted a bacteriologic experiment to understand how bacteria grow.
meanings.sent3: The bacteriologic investigation revealed some surprising facts about bacterial behavior.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a bacteriologic way, meticulously examining every detail.
meanings.sent5: The bacteriologic analysis of the water sample showed high levels of contamination.

meanings.definition: Involving the identification and classification of bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The bacteriologic tests confirmed the presence of harmful bacteria in the food sample.
meanings.sent2: The bacteriologic report detailed the different types of bacteria found in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The bacteriologic detective work led to the discovery of a new bacterial species.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to solving the mystery was like a bacteriologic puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The bacteriologic examination of the patient's blood revealed an unknown strain of bacteria.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the scientific study of bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The bacteriologic conference brought together experts in the field of microbiology.
meanings.sent2: The bacteriologic journal published groundbreaking research on bacterial evolution.
meanings.sent3: The bacteriologic symposium was both informative and engaging for all attendees.
meanings.sent4: Her bacteriologic approach to problem-solving impressed her colleagues in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The bacteriologic investigation shed light on the role of bacteria in environmental processes.
